column4: I want to set up a virtualhost for apache. It seems theres a conventional way of doing that on ubuntu (using sites-available and sites-enabled). Should I just plug in a file in sites-available with a virtual host definition, and then symlink in sites-enabled? Is that all that is to it?
Saviq I see, you wouldnt have a link to some reading about that? I mean there is probably a good reason why its like that. Or is it just to keep apache2.conf simpler?
